lenders.name: Darren Lum
lenders.loan_because: I believe the people of the World can unite to give through this platform where it is able to reach out to those really in need and help fight poverty. One loan of $25 makes no impact, but if millions of people around the World were to feel the same cause and combine their millions of $25, I believe the World would be a better place for all.
lenders.occupational_info: I build for the betterment of mankind. While the urbanised societies advance in leaps, we also must help those in need to be able to move forward.

lenders.name: Greg, Marlene, Maggie
lenders.loan_because: It's our little drop in the great big bucket.

lenders.name: The Mehnert family
lenders.loan_because: It's a great way to show my kids how they can help other people.
lenders.occupational_info: Jim is a Geotechnical engineer and designs foundations and other structures below ground. Julie takes care of Sophia and William who are 5 and 7.

lenders.name: Gerald
lenders.loan_because: This program has enormous potential to change the world for almost no real investment.  For the price of a lunch, one can make a real difference.  Loans are the lifeblood of all business, large or small.
lenders.occupational_info: Investor, business owner, trying to create jobs, and opportunities, and make a change of some manner in the world and community I live in.

lenders.name: Gayle
lenders.loan_because: This is my opportunity to support the positive energies that other people are putting into their lives.  My hope is that together we make this world a better place.
lenders.occupational_info: My work is mostly boring (keeping track of numbers)-- but I love the flexible hours that allow me the opportunity to breed service dogs for Canine Companions for Independence and to visit clients of LAPS (Loving Animals Providing Smiles) with my own therapy dog.

lenders.name: Melissa
lenders.occupational_info: I work with a non-profit foundation that supports other grassroots non-profits aiming to make our world more equitable, healthy and humane.

lenders.loan_because: A little kindness can change a person's life

lenders.name: Jeff

lenders.occupational_info: I build and repair homes for people, working with my hands and basic woodworking power tools. Here in the United States I am well paid for my labor, and I like to loan to other people who work hard with their hands around the world. We are all united in this.

I also hope that by helping a complete stranger, I will help, in a very small way, to foster a spirit of cooperation .
lenders.occupational_info: My job is in IT sales, it is a good job although it has its challanges. I am very fortunate. I also have a small ebiz venture and it has thought me a lot about  myself and the world.

lenders.name: Sean
lenders.loan_because: I see it as a moral imperative to use my privilege in as progressive and empowering a way as I can.  Instead of putting my money in a bank to make me (and the bank) slightly richer, I can offer opportunities to hard working people who deserve but have been denied them.

I also work with a rural development group in El Salvador, leading service-learning trips.

I also try to de-construct power and privilege in my daily life, while fighting the systems that hold us all down.

lenders.name: Michael Talve
lenders.loan_because: I believe microfinance is the best way to help the poorest folks on earth prosper.
lenders.occupational_info:
Fun, exciting and enjoyable...

I market a brand of bar soap and other personal care products that I have spent several months developing. 

We hope to purchase raw materials/ingredients for our products from KIVA borrowers in developing countries; in turn, I would like to help these borrowers develop and grow their businesses by partnering with our company, VIVO Natural Products. 

The brand is appropriately named: VIVO- meaning ALIVE, is how our products will make you feel when you use them. More importantly, VIVO represents the ingredients we use to make each bar of soap. Keeping the entrepreneurial spirit ALIVE is a very important part of my agenda! 

Also, check out FIJI Water @ www.FIJIwater.com - it is a fantastic company and that I am fortunate to be involved with!

lenders.name: aaron
lenders.loan_because:
Sometimes I need money and I know that it is tough to get it and I know that there are people in different parts of the world like in my beautiful PERU that suffer to get a meal for their children. $25.00 is about half tank of gas.
Somewhere else it can be a month's worth of food!!!
lenders.occupational_info: I help salespeople to be successful.

lenders.name: martina
lenders.loan_because: It makes me happy to help people who are trying to improve their lives.

lenders.name: Marian
lenders.loan_because: Everyone wants the opportunity to take care of their  family because put simply, no one wants a hand out.  This is an opportunity to support women who want to take care of their families and better their communities.  There is nothing I can think of that is better than that.

lenders.name: Yellowleaf
lenders.loan_because: ....because it would be totally embarrassing if I told my son to be generous and I don't do it myself.
lenders.occupational_info: I help people.

lenders.name: Denise
lenders.loan_because: during Christmas which is a time for giving, I couldn't think of what I could possibly get for my friends and family that have everything they need.  So I thought why not give a gift that could keep on giving to others around the world that are not as fortunate as us.  I love the fact that I can see how my gifts are growing and bettering others lives all over the world.

lenders.occupational_info: My wife and I are both teachers.  Our two daughters, Kate (17) and Emily (12), have been involved throughout their lives with a variety of self-started charitable activities.

lenders.name: Harish
lenders.loan_because: I was fortunate enough to have received oppurtunities to get educated and make my dreams come true. This is my way of saying thank you to life and trying my bit to empower people and make a positive difference in somebody's life,  I believe that ...We are the world ...we are the children ...we are the ones who can make a brighter day ...so lets start giving ....One day, may be I can become a field partner.

lenders.name: Christopher
lenders.loan_because:
I lived in Africa for 5 years and visited refugee camps on Cambodian border during the Khmer Rouge massacres.  My mother got her help up and I believe that low-income people, especially female entrepreneurs, need access to credit to make their way out of 
poverty.  We are lucky to participate in even a small way.
lenders.occupational_info: Computer manufacturer

lenders.name: Christopher
lenders.loan_because: As a young entrepreneur I believe it is essential to help people achieve their dreams. This is especially true in developing economies.  This is my way of giving back.
